JobFullDesc:
Amazon Stores is a unique extension of Amazon.com that focuses on in-person shopping experiences through our retail stores. We are passionate about creating a shopping experience that customers love. Innovation is part of our DNA! Our goal is to be Earths’ most customer centric company and we are just getting started. We need people who want to join an ambitious program that continues to push the state of the art and impacts the daily lives of our customers. If you enjoy being an inventor and you want to join a fast-past, innovative team that is making history and breaking new ground for Amazon’s retail stores, this is the place for you.

You’re an innovative and passionate EHS leader and you love working with people in the field to improve processes and EHS performance. You thrive working in a dynamic, ambiguous, fast-paced environment in which managing multiple projects and priorities is the norm. You excel at solving problems, developing processes and improving them. You’re detail oriented. You understand when to own a decision and when to get input from others. You’re entrepreneurial and love start-ups: you like to build things from scratch. No road map? No problem. You’ll figure it out. You have a strong bias for action; you’re self-starting, tenacious, and results-oriented. You’re willing to roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to meet team goals. You are an articulate, persuasive communicator and a good writer. You have a track record of exceptional performance and have excellent judgment and high standards. People trust and respect you and they like to work with you.Our team is seeking an Environment, Health and Safety Leader who will support a number of our stores on the West or East Coast. You will work with our store leadership and associates, building and deploying EHS programs and standard operating procedures, and ensuring our customers and associates have a safe experience when visiting or working with us. You will understand the hazards that can impact associates in a retail and manufacturing environment, as well as appreciate our customer obsession as we innovate our business in the retail space. You will need to thrive and deliver results in an ambiguous, fast-paced, dynamic business environment, supported by your leadership team. You should have excellent ownership, and solid leadership engagement skills.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
· Completed Bachelor’s Degree in occupational health and safety (or a similar field) from an accredited university.· 5+ years’ experience managing EHS in a retail, logistics, distribution, or manufacturing environment.· Demonstrated ability to conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis to determine the root cause of EHS problems and then develop solutions to effectively address those issues.· Proven ability to influence the decisions of leaders through effective verbal and written communication, logical reasoning, relevant data, and the presentation of alternative solutions.· History of teamwork and willingness to roll up one's sleeves to get the job done.. Up to 50% Travel
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
· Masters degree in occupational safety and health, or similar field
